children.label: TimeDateSetReq_ICM
desc:
Part    No of bits     LSB           MSB     Value range      Scaling    Offset     Max Hex   Invalid HEX
                              offset         offset     Min   ->   Max
Year         8             56              63        2000      2254       1         2000        0xFE          0xFF
Month      8             48              55          0            12         1             0          0x0C          0xFF
Day          8             40              47          0            31         1             0          0x1F          0xFF
Hour         8             32              39          0           23          1             0          0x17          0xFF
Minute      8             24              31          0           59          1             0          0x3B          0xFF
Second    8             16              23          0           59          1             0          0x3B          0xFF


Description                Size    Start bit     End bit    Unit of measure     Meaning
TimeAdjustRequest    1         8              8             Binary      0: No time adjust request 1: Time adjust request
DateAdjustRequest    1         9              9             Binary 0: No date adjust request 1: Date adjust request

Reserved                  14         0                13

LSB/MSB offsets are in Motorola Backwards format.

Year shall be treated as the most significant byte of the string, and read/written first in rd/wr_bytes().

children.label: FuelPumpEnableDataControl
desc:
Fuel Pump Enable
Byte 1:
00 = Idle, 
01 = Key Status, 
03 = Response, 
05 = Terminate

The MSB of the signal must be written to the COM layer first (with an offset of zero in wr_bytes() ) and therefore transmitted on the bus first.
Similarly, subscribing modules will receive the MSB of the signal when they call rd_bytes(0).

E.g. wr_bytes(0) = published_signal_MSB;

Subscribed_Signal_MSB = rd_bytes(0);

children.label: CBDSDiagnosticsData
desc: IPB / ABS CBDS Diagnostic / Event Information PDU that is updated  when there are pre-defined events. Such events (for instance when a fault occurs or there is a certain type of controller intervention e.g. DSC) will trigger the PDU to send data to the GWM for forwarding to an offboarding service. The PDU is multiplexed and signal definitions are kept within Chassis Motion Control Systems, and within Bosch. The Data that is captured from the PDU can then be decoded by JLR and Bosch engineering for analysis. It contains more detailed fault data to help with more efficient root cause analysis, and also customer usage data to help improve the design of the components on the car.

children.label: OCSPassSeatOccupied
desc:
The Occupant classification is determined by the combination of the signals OCSPassSeatOccupied and OCSPassWeightEst. Only 2 states are affected by the status of the Passenger Seat Belt Status, which means that an Empty status is overriden to Inhibit status if the Passenger seat belt status is Buckled and  an Inhibit status is overriden to Empty if the Passenger seat belt status is Unbuckled if and only if the pressure correspond to an Empty classification.

Once the classification is determined by the OCS those 2 bytes are used by the RCM to determine if the AIR bag should be deploy or not, that decision is taken by the RCM, the OCS only transmit the classification. 

OCSPassSeatOccupied=0x00 & OCSPassWeightEst=0x00 : Empty, Deployment inhibited.
 
OCSPassSeatOccupied=0x01 & OCSPassWeightEst=0x00 : Occupied Disabled, Deployment inhibited.

OCSPassSeatOccupied=0x00 & OCSPassWeightEst=0x01 : Indeterminate, Default value.

OCSPassSeatOccupied=0x01 & OCSPassWeightEst=0x01 : Occupied Enable Small, deployment allowed.

children.label: TorqConvSlip
desc:
For non-Hybrid vehicles:
Slip between engine speed and turbine speed.
e.g.1. With engine speed = 1000 & turbine = 500 (Acceleration)
TorqConvSlip =  50% (i.e. turbine 50% slower than engine)
e.g.2. Engine speed = 500 & turbine = 1000 (Over-run)
TorqConvSlip = -100% (i.e. turbine 100% fast than engine)

For Hybrid vehicles:
 - With torque converter: Slip between the engine / electric machine speeds and turbine speed.
 - Without torque converter: Slip between the engine / electric machine speeds and transmission output shaft speed.

children.label: TransIPSpeed

For non-Hybrid vehicles, this indicates the Transmission actual input shaft speed.
For Hybrid vehicles this indicates the Transmissions virtual Input Speed based upon slip control of the IAE.

children.label: VolumetricStatus
desc:
Encoding:

Byte 1, bits 0 - 1: VolumetricStatus
00 = Sensor Sleep
01 = Sensor Unset
10 = Sensor Set
11 = Sensor Triggered

Byte 1 , bit 2 : Self Test
0 = Sensor self-test OK
1 = Sensor self-test NOK

Byte 1 , bit 3 : EEPROM Status
0 = EEPROM OK
1 = EEPROM  NOK

Byte 1, bits 4 - 7:
not used


Byte 2, bits 0 - 5: Parameter Setting
Settings for each vehicle model, (0 - 63)

Byte 2, bit 6: Fan Mode
0 = Fan running
1 = Fan not running

Byte 2, bit 7: wWindow position
0 = Windows closed
1 = A Window open

Non Hybrid: The signal informs about the pressure in the master cylinder.
Hybrid: Indicates the pressure that would be present at the master cylinder for the same total
brake torque delivered by the HEV braking system compared to a conventional braking system.

Note: The signal saturates at 204.6 bar. The actual brake pressure can exceed 204.6 bar.

children.label: VehicleSpeedQF_M2
desc: Quality factor for the signal VehicleSpeed. EuCD compliant signal.

children.label: VehicleSpeed_M2
desc:
Use in conjunction with VehicleSpeedQF. A value of 65535d may also be set under error conditions.
 
Rear Wheel Drive and AWD Vehicles: VehicleSpeed is calculated as the average speed of the two driven rear wheels. If one wheel speed sensor fails, VehicleSpeed will use the speed information from the other sensor.  

Four Wheel Drive Vehicles: VehicleSpeed is calculated as the average speed of all four wheels. In the case of wheel speed sensor failures, VehicleSpeed will use the speed information from the remaining sensors.

Front Wheel Drive and AWD Vehicles: VehicleSpeed is calculated as the average speed of the two driven front wheels. If one wheel speed sensor fails, VehicleSpeed will use the speed information from the other sensor.

Rolling circumference values used in vehicle speed calculation differ per carline.
If you are interested in knowing the rolling circumference values, please contact the ABS team- Tim Reynolds (treyno13)

children.label: SteeringWheelAngle
desc:
This signal provides the a measurement of the steering wheel position. The angle is measured as referenced from a 0 degree straight-ahead position. 

- If the steering wheel is rotated clockwise, the measurement decreases.
- If the steering wheel is rotated anti-clockwise, the measurement increases.

On certain vehicle lines fitted with relative angle sensors, the straight-ahead position may have to be 'learned' in each ignition cycle after a brief period of driving. On vehicles fitted with absolute angle sensors, this is not the case.

Depending on the vehicle electrical architecture, the signal may be sourced via the ABS module or direct from the SASM.

The MSB of the signal must be written to the COM layer first (with an offset of zero in wr_bytes() ) and therefore transmitted on the bus first.
Similarly, subscribing modules will receive the MSB of the signal when they call rd_bytes(0).

E.g. wr_bytes(0) = published_signal_MSB;

Subscribed_Signal_MSB = rd_bytes(0);

Refer to STJLR 18.276 for more detail.

children.label: SteeringWheelAngleStatus
desc: 2-bit signal relating to SteeringWheelAngleUnsigned. This flag indicates progress with the Learn Centre Algorithm. This signal will indicate a value of 1 (Centre not learned) at the start of every ignition cycle before the algorithm has had a chance to run. As the algorithm runs to completion, the value will increment to 3. Certain exceptional conditions may cause the algorithm to re-run mid-igntion cycle. A fault with the sensor is indicated by a value of 0.

children.label: TCUDataTarget
desc:
CAN signal used by BCM to send 'auth challenge query' & request status to TCU, Telematics feature authorisation, Byte1 definition >> 02: Challenge Query, 05: Status
00 00 XX XX XX XX XX XX Idle
00 11 XX XX XX XX XX XX Idle - Driver ID Authentication Valid Passive Start
00 12 XX XX XX XX XX XX Idle - Driver ID Authentication Valid Transponder Start
00 04 XX XX XX XX XX XX Idle - Driver ID Authentication Invalid
02 C1 C2 C3 C4 C5 C6 XX Challenge Query - C1 - C6 (6 byte RN#)
05 81 7F XX XX XX XX XX Enable status = TCU Auth / Ok
05 01 00 XX XX XX XX XX Disable status = NOK (Target SID Not Stored)
05 01 03 XX XX XX XX XX Disable status = BLOCKED
05 01 04 XX XX XX XX XX Disabled status = Driver ID Authentication Invalid
05 01 81 XX XX XX XX XX Disable status = Challenge Error
XX - Don't Care

children.label: ODORollingCount2101
desc:
A rolling count (counts through zero) of distance travelled.
In steps of 0.000125 miles
00h = 0 miles
FEh = 0.03175 miles travelled since last roll-over.

RWD / AWD Vehicles:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Derived primarily from the two driven rear wheels. If one wheel speed sensor fails, the speed
Information from the other sensor is used. If both rear speed sensors fail, the signal defaults.

4WD Vehicles: 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Derived from the four driven wheels. In the case of wheel speed sensor failures, speed
information from the remaining sensors is used instead. If all four speed sensors fail, the signal
defaults.

4WD BEV Vehicles:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Derived from the four driven wheels. In the case of wheel speed sensor failures, speed
information from the remaining sensors is used instead. If all four speed sensors fail, the signal
defaults.

FWD / AWD Vehicles:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Derived primarily from the two driven front wheels. If one wheel speed sensor fails, the speed
information from the other sensor is used. If both rear speed sensors fail, the signal defaults.

Rolling circumference values used in vehicle speed calculation differ per carline.
If you are interested in knowing the rolling circumference values, please contact the ABS team- Tim Reynolds (treyno13)

children.label: CVLCBMCMReq
desc:
Request to CVLC from the VLCA within BMCM. The signal's value is a bitmask so encoded: 

Bit 0 = CVLC_REQUEST_REASON_1, 0 = No Request, 1 = Request
Bit 1 = CVLC_REQUEST_REASON_2, 0 = No Request, 1 = Request
Bit 2 = CVLC_REQUEST_REASON_3, 0 = No Request, 1 = Request
Bit 3 = CVLC_REQUEST_REASON_4, 0 = No Request, 1 = Request
Bit 4 = CVLC_REQUEST_REASON_5, 0 = No Request, 1 = Request
Bit 5 = CVLC_REQUEST_REASON_6, 0 = No Request, 1 = Request
Bit 6 = CVLC_REQUEST_REASON_7, 0 = No Request, 1 = Request
Bit 7 = CVLC_REQUEST_REASON_8, 0 = No Request, 1 = Request
all 8 bits equal to 0 = CVLC_REQUEST_NO_REASON
all 8 bits equal to 1 = CVLC_REQUEST_ALL

children.label: HVBattWeldCheckStats
desc:
The HV battery shall set the value of CAN signal HVBattWeldCheckStatus_HY as follows: 
a. Set the signal equal to 'weld detected' (0x1) if the positive or negative main contactor was diagnosed as welded during the most recent execution of the main contactor weld diagnostics. 
b. Set the signal equal to 'no weld detected' (0x0) if the positive and negative main contactor weld diagnostics completed successfully (i.e. no welds detected) during their most recent execution. 

Note that the behaviour described above is in addition to the 'CAT7' response of the HV battery to a detected welded contactor.

children.label: UTCTimeDate
desc:
Date and time is based on Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 

Part:  No of bits     LSB      MSB             Value range        Scaling     Offset

                             offset    offset             Min     -> Max



Year        8               40         47             2000         2254          1          2000

Month      8              32         39                0              12            1             0

Day         8              24          31                0              31            1             0

Hour        8              16          23                0              23            1             0 

Minute     8               8           15                0              59            1             0 

Second   8               0             7                0              59            1             0 

sync        4             48            51              0              15            1             0


LSB/MSB offsets are in Motorola Backwards format, and are offsets within the signal. 

Offsets within the frame may be different.

 

Year shall be treated as the most significant byte of the string, and read/written first in rd/wr_bytes().

Below is the definition for sync
0 - No sync
1 - GNSS sync
2 - NITZ sync
3 - NTP sync

children.label: UUDTBCMResponse3
desc:
Unacknowledged Unsegmented Data Transfer Signal from the BCM. Used for rapid data transfer in compliance with:

Ford GGDS (Generic Global Diagnostic Specification).
ISO 14229
ISO 15765-3.

UUDTBCMResponse3 shall always be packaged into CAN Identifier 0x68A.

The timing specified within GGDS for frame transfers is:
Slow: 1000ms period
Medium: 100ms period
Fast: Specified by transmitting application supplier.

NOTE: All Volcano Timing Analysis has been performed on this signal at the Medium Rate (100ms). Any attempt to transmit the Message containing this signal at a faster rate may result in unknown delays on the vehicle CAN Bus, which could potentially disrupt normal functionality. In addition, transmission rates faster than Medium cannot be guaranteed.

The MSB of the signal must be written to the COM layer first (with an offset of zero in wr_bytes() ) and therefore transmitted on the bus first.
Similarly, subscribing modules will receive the MSB of the signal when they call rd_bytes(0).

E.g. wr_bytes(0) = published_signal_MSB;
Subscribed_Signal_MSB = rd_bytes(0);

children.label: VehicleSpeed
desc:
Use in conjunction with VehicleSpeedQF. A value of 65535d may also be set under error conditions.
 
Rear Wheel Drive and AWD Vehicles: VehicleSpeed is calculated as the average speed of the two driven rear wheels. If one wheel speed sensor fails, VehicleSpeed will use the speed information from the other sensor.  

Four Wheel Drive Vehicles: VehicleSpeed is calculated as the average speed of all four wheels. In the case of wheel speed sensor failures, VehicleSpeed will use the speed information from the remaining sensors.

Front Wheel Drive and AWD Vehicles: VehicleSpeed is calculated as the average speed of the two driven front wheels. If one wheel speed sensor fails, VehicleSpeed will use the speed information from the other sensor.

Rolling circumference values used in vehicle speed calculation differ per carline.
If you are interested in knowing the rolling circumference values, please contact the ABS team- Tim Reynolds (treyno13)

children.label: DoorStatus
desc:
Indicates the status of the doors.

L538 Only
'The group DoorStatusGrp is required to keep DoorStatus and DriverDoorStatusQF in the same CAN frame for L538.  It is not a requirement for the data to be calculated and written at the same time in the application software of the transmiting node.'

Bit 0 = DDStatus, 0 = open, 1 = closed
Bit 1 = PDStatus, 0 = open, 1 = closed
Bit 2 = LRDStatus, 0 = open, 1 = closed
Bit 3 = RRDStatus, 0 = open, 1 = closed
Bit 4 = TailgateStatus, 0 = open, 1 = closed
Bit 5 = EngineHoodStatus, 0 = open, 1 = closed

children.label: LSPPartInfoBlkNo
desc: This is the block counter for the part number for the  Loadspace Switch Pack. Starts at zero. Incrementing block identifier count for each use of the frame identifier on the bus. PartInfoBlkNo wraps around when the implementation-specific last value is reached. Masters should monitor PartInfoBlkNo until all required data is transferred, or a wrap-around occurs.
